p: A drug agent that is capable of inhibiting fluid accumulation in this technique is considered as having anti-inflammatory activity [ 27]. The results reported herein suggest remarkable anti-inflammatory effects of the aqueous and methanolic stem bark extracts of P. thonningii as evidenced by their ability to inhibit/reduce xylene-induced ear oedema in experimental mice. Particularly, the aqueous stem bark extract of P. thonningii proved to be more potent than the methanolic extract of the same plant, at all the studied dose levels.
